definition: bit (of a bridle)/to hold in the mouth/to harbor (feelings)/to link/to accept/rank/title
to receive/to answer (the phone)/to meet or welcome sb/to connect/to catch/to join/to extend/to take one's turn on duty/to take over for sb

sentences.english: However, a participant took the view that the number of seats should dovetail with the future constitutional system.
sentences.chinese: 但有嘉賓認爲，議席數目須與未來的政制銜接。

sentences.english: Punctuation marks are an integrant sign of cohesion and coherence in modern writing.
sentences.chinese: 標點符號是現代書面語中不可缺少的銜接和連貫標誌。

sentences.english: I think me and Alex alternate quite well.
sentences.chinese: 我覺得我和阿萊克斯轉換銜接的還算不錯。

sentences.english: The continuous transformation connects smoothly to the unit operator .
sentences.chinese: 連續變換光滑地銜接到單位算符。

sentences.english: Individual gutter sections can be connected or joined with snap-in-place connectors.
sentences.chinese: 水溝局部能夠零丁或與銜接單位當場銜接器參加。

sentences.english: Individual gutter sections can be connected or joined with snap-in-place connectors.
sentences.chinese: 水溝局部能夠零丁或與銜接單位當場銜接器參加。

sentences.english: In helping the sub-menu is the convergence of the system related presentations.
sentences.chinese: 在幫助的子菜單就是銜接該系統的相關介紹。

sentences.english: With over 30 points of articulation, you can create incredible yet subtle poses.
sentences.chinese: 擁有超過30點的銜接，可以創造難以置信的姿勢。

sentences.english: Finally, the cohesion and coherence of discourse also have an impact on the translation of polysemic words.
sentences.chinese: 同時，語篇的銜接與連貫也作用於多義詞的翻譯。

sentences.english: The trolleybus connects here with a bus for the airport.
sentences.chinese: 這輛無軌電車與開往機場的公共汽車銜接。

sentences.english: The electronic translator can also be interfaced to other communications devices, such as telephones.
sentences.chinese: 電子翻譯也可以銜接到其他通信設備，例如電話。

sentences.english: To the Strait of Hormuz and the Gulf of Oman and the Arabian Sea converge.
sentences.chinese: 以霍爾木茲海峽和阿曼灣與阿拉伯海銜接。

sentences.english: The arch died away against the towers.
sentences.chinese: 弓形結構與塔狀結構相銜接。

sentences.english: Strictly implement production plan to ensure the balanced production and the linkage between different working orders.
sentences.chinese: 嚴格執行生產計劃，保證均衡生產和工序間的銜接。

sentences.english: The two space vehicles locked on to each other.
sentences.chinese: 那兩隻航天器銜接起來了。

sentences.english: Articulation includes ball-jointed neck, shoulders, elbows, wrists, and swivel waist.
sentences.chinese: 銜接包括球體關節頸，肩，肘，手腕，腰和旋轉。

definition: to join up/to dock/a joint (between components)
to link/to join/to attach/connection/a link (on web page)
to establish ties or contact/in series connection (electricity)
to coordinate/to harmonize/to fit together/to match (colors etc)/harmonious/concerted
to link up (disparate elements)/coherent (narrative, argument etc)
to run through/a connecting thread from beginning to end/to link
to impel/to carry forward/to push on/to advance/to drive forward
to push (for acceptance of a plan)/to push forward/to promote/to actuate/CL:個|个[ge4]
railtrack connection/to integrate into sth/to dock/to connect/to be in step with/to bring into line with/to align
